intro: Sericocarpus oregonensis subsp. californicus, commonly known as the California lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a low-growing herb with small, hairy leaves and produces clusters of tiny, pinkish-white flowers. The plant belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, seed-like fruits called sericocarps. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its botanical features make it a unique and ecologically significant species in its native range.
